Package it.unimol.monopoly.app

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.unimol.monopoly.app.Game
public class Game extends Object
Initialization class of the game of Monopoly. The methods in this class are used only once. In fact, the moment the user clicks on the button "Start Game" inside the MainForm, all the below methods are called, and they provide the creation of the contracts, the order of the players' turns and the automatic purchase of initial contracts. If the state of the game is saved and the application closed and re-executed, this class won't be called anymore, as everything that had to be generated was successfully done and saved on file.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Angelo Trotta

    • generateOrder

      public PlayerManager generateOrder(PlayerManager players)
      It generates an order for all players' turns. The method works first of all by creating a list of integers, to which the IDs of each player are incremented by one and then added, going from the value of 1 to the maximum of 6. After that, the list is randomly shuffled, obtaining a set of random IDs from 1 to 6. The player IDs in the current manager are then updated, but it still has the previous order of the turns. So, to finish, a new, updated manager is created, which has the new order, and it's returned to the caller.
      Parameters:
      players - The player manager.
      Returns:
      A new instance of the PlayerManager with the updated order.

    • setFirstPlayer

      public Player setFirstPlayer(PlayerManager players)
      It finds the player with the smallest possible ID inside the new player manager updated with a random order of turns, who will be the first player to start the match.
      Parameters:
      players - The player manager.
      Returns:
      The starting player.

    • setMatchContracts

      public ContractManager setMatchContracts(ContractManager contracts)
      All the Monopoly contracts are first created, then added to the contract manager. Check the monopoly rules for more information.
      Parameters:
      contracts - The contract manager is passed in input.
      Returns:
      The updated contract manager.

    • generateRandomContracts

      public List<Contract> generateRandomContracts(ContractManager contracts)
      Initial contracts are generated for each player, until a maximum value, given by the variable initialContracts. The method works by creating an empty list of contracts first, then adding available contracts to that, which are randomly shuffled. From this bigger list, another, more compact one, is created, and this will have a number of contracts given by the variable quoted above.
      Parameters:
      contracts - The contract manager.
      Returns:
      The compact list of random contracts.

    • buyInitialContracts

      public int buyInitialContracts(Player player, List<Contract> contracts)
      Once initial contracts are generated for every player, they all need to be purchased. This is an always possible operation since the starting quantity of money for each player is much greater than their cost. So, a small quantity of money, equal to the cost of the contracts, is subtracted from each player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player passed in input.
      contracts - The list of initial owned contracts by the player.
      Returns:
      The sum of the price of all contracts.
